original_title: No existen treinta y seis maneras de mostrar cómo un hombre se sube a un caballo
overview: "Nicolás Zukerfeld’s third feature is a wry, surprising work of filmmaking-as-criticism that begins as a kind of supercut of moments from the work of pantheon Hollywood auteur Raoul Walsh. This rhythmically entrancing parade of images traces a mysterious and amusing arc across the director’s vast oeuvre—but at the halfway mark, the film reinvents itself as an idiosyncratic, essayistic investigation into memory, cinema, and their shared mutability." - NYFF
title: There Are Not Thirty-Six Ways of Showing a Man Getting on a Horse
